content:
LocalClientSecuritySettings Class

Definition

Specifies local client security settings.

In this Article

public sealed class LocalClientSecuritySettings
Inheritance
System.Object
LocalClientSecuritySettings

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Examples

This example shows how to use the LocalClientSecuritySettings class. 

            // Create an instance of the binding to use.
            WSHttpBinding b = new WSHttpBinding();

            // Get the binding element collection.
            BindingElementCollection bec = b.CreateBindingElements();

            // Find the SymmetricSecurityBindingElement in the collection.
            // Important: Cast to the SymmetricSecurityBindingElement when using the Find
            // method.
            SymmetricSecurityBindingElement sbe = (SymmetricSecurityBindingElement)
                bec.Find<SecurityBindingElement>();

            // Get the LocalSecuritySettings from the binding element.
            LocalClientSecuritySettings lc = sbe.LocalClientSettings;

            // Print out values.
            Console.WriteLine("Maximum cookie caching time: {0} days", lc.MaxCookieCachingTime.Days);
            Console.WriteLine("Replay Cache Size: {0}", lc.ReplayCacheSize);
            Console.WriteLine("ReplayWindow: {0} minutes", lc.ReplayWindow.Minutes);
            Console.WriteLine("MaxClockSkew: {0} minutes", lc.MaxClockSkew.Minutes);
            Console.ReadLine();

            // Change the MaxClockSkew to 3 minutes.
            lc.MaxClockSkew = new TimeSpan(0, 0, 3, 0);

            // Print the new value.
            Console.WriteLine("New MaxClockSkew: {0} minutes", lc.MaxClockSkew.Minutes);
            Console.ReadLine();

            // Create an EndpointAddress for the service.
            EndpointAddress ea = new EndpointAddress("http://localhost/calculator");

            // Create a client. The binding has the changed MaxClockSkew.
            // CalculatorClient cc = new CalculatorClient(b, ea);
            // Use the new client. (Not shown.)
            // cc.Close();

			' Create an instance of the binding to use.
			Dim b As New WSHttpBinding()

			' Get the binding element collection.
			Dim bec As BindingElementCollection = b.CreateBindingElements()

			' Find the SymmetricSecurityBindingElement in the collection.
			' Important: Cast to the SymmetricSecurityBindingElement when using the Find
			' method.
			Dim sbe As SymmetricSecurityBindingElement = CType(bec.Find(Of SecurityBindingElement)(), SymmetricSecurityBindingElement)

			' Get the LocalSecuritySettings from the binding element.
			Dim lc As LocalClientSecuritySettings = sbe.LocalClientSettings

			' Print out values.
			Console.WriteLine("Maximum cookie caching time: {0} days", lc.MaxCookieCachingTime.Days)
			Console.WriteLine("Replay Cache Size: {0}", lc.ReplayCacheSize)
			Console.WriteLine("ReplayWindow: {0} minutes", lc.ReplayWindow.Minutes)
			Console.WriteLine("MaxClockSkew: {0} minutes", lc.MaxClockSkew.Minutes)
			Console.ReadLine()

			' Change the MaxClockSkew to 3 minutes.
			lc.MaxClockSkew = New TimeSpan(0, 0, 3, 0)

			' Print the new value.
			Console.WriteLine("New MaxClockSkew: {0} minutes", lc.MaxClockSkew.Minutes)
			Console.ReadLine()

			' Create an EndpointAddress for the service.
			Dim ea As New EndpointAddress("http://localhost/calculator")

			' Create a client. The binding has the changed MaxClockSkew.
			' CalculatorClient cc = new CalculatorClient(b, ea);
			' Use the new client. (Not shown.)
			' cc.Close();

Remarks

This class contains the local security settings used by the SecurityBindingElement (and classes derived from it) to build the security channel. These settings are local to the client and are not determined from the service's security policy.

Constructors

LocalClientSecuritySettings()

Initializes a new instance of the LocalClientSecuritySettings class.

public LocalClientSecuritySettings ();

Properties

CacheCookies

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether secure conversation cookies are cached.

public bool CacheCookies { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if cookies are cached; otherwise, false.

CookieRenewalThresholdPercentage

Gets or sets the threshold percentage for renewal of secure conversation cookies.

public int CookieRenewalThresholdPercentage { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The threshold percentage for renewing secure conversation cookies. The default is 60 percent.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The property is set to a value less than 0 or greater than 100.

Remarks

The client caches secure conversation cookies and when a cached cookie is going to expire in the near future, the client automatically gets a new cookie from the service. The value of this property determines what percentage of the cached cookie's validity period must be over before getting a new cookie. For example, if the value of this property is 60, and the client has a secure conversation cookie that is valid for 100 minutes, it reuses the cached cookie for 60 minutes, after which it gets a new cookie from the service.

DetectReplays

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether replay detection is enabled on messages the client receives from the service.

public bool DetectReplays { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if replay detection is enabled; otherwise, false. The default is true.

IdentityVerifier

Gets or sets the identity verifier.

public System.ServiceModel.Security.IdentityVerifier IdentityVerifier { get; set; }
Value
IdentityVerifier

An instance of an implementation of the abstract class IdentityVerifier.

Remarks

This property is used to verify that the remote endpoint that the client channel is communicating with matches the identity specified in the EndpointAddress that the channel is targeted for.

MaxClockSkew

Gets or sets the maximum allowable time difference between the system clocks of the two parties that are communicating.

public TimeSpan MaxClockSkew { get; set; }
Value
TimeSpan

A TimeSpan that represents the maximum allowable time difference between the system clocks of the two parties that are communicating. The default is 5 minutes.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The property is set to a value less than 0.

Remarks

Messages between systems whose clocks' difference exceeds the value specified in this property are rejected.

This property is used in conjunction with the message time stamp verification and the ReplayWindow property.

For more information, see How to: Set a Max Clock Skew.

MaxCookieCachingTime

Gets or sets the maximum caching time for secure conversation cookies.

public TimeSpan MaxCookieCachingTime { get; set; }
Value
TimeSpan

A TimeSpan that represents the maximum caching time for secure conversation cookies. The default is 10675199 days.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The property is set to a value less than 0.

NonceCache

Gets or sets the cache for the local client security settings.

public System.ServiceModel.Security.NonceCache NonceCache { get; set; }
Value
NonceCache

The cache for the local client security settings.

ReconnectTransportOnFailure

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether security sessions attempt to reconnect after transport failures.

public bool ReconnectTransportOnFailure { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if security sessions attempt to reconnect after transport failures; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Remarks

If this flag is set to true, the client tries to send messages that correspond to a single security session over multiple transport connections. It establishes a new transport connection if the previous connection fails. This is useful in the case of secure WS-ReliableMessaging because the client requires the session to tolerate transient transport failures.

ReplayCacheSize

Gets or sets the number of cached nonces used for replay detection.

public int ReplayCacheSize { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The number of cached nonces used for replay detection. The default is 900000.

Remarks

A nonce is a "number used once", often a random number used in an authentication protocol to ensure that old communications cannot be used in an attack by using replays.

If the nonce count is exceeded, the incoming message is rejected and a MessageSecurityException is thrown. Old nonces are removed in a timely manner.

ReplayWindow

Gets or sets the maximum time that a message nonce is valid.

public TimeSpan ReplayWindow { get; set; }
Value
TimeSpan

A TimeSpan that represents the maximum time that a message nonce is valid. The default is five minutes.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The property is set to a value less than 0.

Remarks

A nonce is a "number used once", often a random number used in an authentication protocol to ensure that old communications cannot be used in an attack by using replays.

SessionKeyRenewalInterval

Gets or sets the time span after which the initiator renews the key for the security session.

public TimeSpan SessionKeyRenewalInterval { get; set; }
Value
TimeSpan

A TimeSpan that represents the time span after which the initiator renews the key for the security session. The default is 10 hours.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The property is set to a value less than 0.

Remarks

Session settings such as this one are applicable under any of the following conditions:

  • All client credential types for WSDualHttpBinding and NetTcpBinding.

  • If <reliableSession> element is enabled.

  • If <reliableSession> element is not enabled, on WSHttpBinding with UserName = true or Windows = true.

    Session settings such as this one are not applicable under any of the following conditions:

  • For BasicHttpBinding.

  • For NetNamedPipeBinding.

  • If <reliableSession> element is not enabled, on WSHttpBinding with ClientCertificate = true or with none of the ClientCredentials properties set to true.

SessionKeyRolloverInterval

Gets or sets the time interval for which the previous session key is valid on incoming messages during a key renewal.

public TimeSpan SessionKeyRolloverInterval { get; set; }
Value
TimeSpan

A TimeSpan that represents the time interval for which the previous session key is valid on incoming messages after a key renewal. The default is 5 minutes.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The property is set to a value less than 0.

Remarks

After key renewal, the client and the server should always send messages using the most current available key. Both parties can accept incoming messages secured with the previous session key until the rollover time expires.

Session settings such as this one are applicable under any of the following conditions:

  • All client credential types for WSDualHttpBinding and NetTcpBinding.

  • If <reliableSession> element is enabled.

  • If <reliableSession> element is not enabled, on WSHttpBinding with UserName = true or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials.windows%2A> = true.

    Session settings such as this one are not applicable under any of the following conditions:

  • For BasicHttpBinding.

  • For NetNamedPipeBinding.

  • If <reliableSession> element is not enabled, on WSHttpBinding with ClientCertificate = true or with none of the ClientCredentials properties set to true.

TimestampValidityDuration

Gets or sets the maximum duration that the messages are valid when sent by the client. If a message is received by the service after this duration, it should discard the message.

public TimeSpan TimestampValidityDuration { get; set; }
Value
TimeSpan

A TimeSpan that represents the maximum duration that the messages are valid when sent by the client. The default is 5 minutes.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The property is set to a value less than 0.

Methods

Clone()

Creates a new instance of this class, which is a copy or clone of the current instance.

public System.ServiceModel.Channels.LocalClientSecuritySettings Clone ();
Returns
LocalClientSecuritySettings

A new instance of LocalClientSecuritySettings.
